intro: Neoporteria volliana var. breviaristata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed neoporteria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and ornamental value in gardens.
